page.title: 11WILBERFOSS TREE SURVEY.
page.content: A survey was conducted in Spring 1985. It concerned only wild or natural trees within the village boundary. The results recorded as percentages were as follows:- {Holly }3.4% {Poplar }4.8% {Ash }11.7% {Black poplar }0.6% {Sycamore }17.9% {Goat willow }4.8% {Spindle }1.3% {Chestnut }11.7% {Beech }2.7% {Hawthorn }2.0% {Oak }13.1% {Willow 9.6% {Elm }2.7% {Alder }1.3% {Silver birch }12.4%. {Sycamore}was found to be the most common species of tree in the village. There is much interest in saving as many trees as possible and a tree planting programme is beginning in 1985. Some of the most attractive trees in the village will be lost when the beck is widened to prevent winter flooding.
